title: 820-00281 Missing PP3V0_G3H
message: So I have an 820-00281 that is at 20V. 30mA and has all the G3H rails up to PP3V0_G3H, which is at .01V and appears to have a 1.0 Ohm short to GND. Sadly thee liquid that I found was to the right of U1100. After looking at this rail rail. I see there only a few components and then U1100 and U7800. I still need to look at where this rail comes from but I do not have a good feeling.

title: 820-00281 Missing PP3V0_G3H
message:
Fixed two corroded resistors above U1100 and now have PP3V0_G3H.

PP3V3_SUS is .219V now and I am getting  3 ohms...

title: 820-00281 Missing PP3V0_G3H
message: great now PP3V3_SUS is 1V. This board is confusing the heck outta me

title: 820-00281 Missing PP3V0_G3H
message:
Possibly accumulated crap under CPU.
Heat to 180-200 degrees, for 15-20s.
May need to do the same with SMC and U7800.

title: 820-00281 Missing PP3V0_G3H
message:
Celsius, of course.
You only need to burn the crap, not to melt the balls.

title: 820-00281 Missing PP3V0_G3H
message: Ah ok. Well I figured Celsius, so I tried it and no change.

title: 820-00281 Missing PP3V0_G3H
message: You should heat all BGA chips and finally pass the board through UC.

title: 820-00281 Missing PP3V0_G3H
message: Ok, did that and no change. I can see crap under U1100 which I assume is the PCH.

title: 820-00281 Missing PP3V0_G3H
message: You may need to reball it...

title: 820-00281 Missing PP3V0_G3H
message: Yeah, I think so. DO you know of anyone that has reballed one of these boards by hand? I do not have a BGA reball machine. I do have the stencil for this chip though.

title: 820-00281 Missing PP3V0_G3H
message:
Just to reiterate:  

PP3V3_SUS is currently at 1.1V. This signal is created by U8200 via pin 3. U8200 is supplied by PP3V3_S5 on pin 2 which is supplied from U7650, which it has 3.3V. U8200 is told to turn on by the power rail PM_SLP_SUS_L which comes from pin 238 of U1100, which by no coincidence is also the only IC with foreign material under it from liquid damage. This signal is at 1.5V.
